content.question: An object is moving in a straight line along the <math alttext="x " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis. The net force <math alttext="F sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> exerted on the object as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is shown in the graph. Which of the following could be the momentum <math alttext="p sub x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of the object as a function of <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled p sub x. The graph consists of three line segments. The first line segment begins at the origin. It extends upward and to the right until it ends at a point about halfway up the vertical axis, and one third of the way along the horizontal axis. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, and extends horizontally to the right until it ends about two thirds of the way along the horizontal axis. The third line segment begins where the second line segment ends, and extends downward and to the right until it ends on the horizontal axis, far from the origin.

The figure presents a graph in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled p sub x. The graph consists of three line segments. The first line segment begins at the origin. It extends downward and to the right until it ends at a point about halfway down the vertical axis, and one third of the way along the horizontal axis. The second line segment begins where the first line segment ends, and extends horizontally to the right until it ends about two thirds of the way along the horizontal axis. The third line segment begins where the second line segment ends, and extends upward and to the right until it ends on the horizontal axis, far from the origin.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled p sub x. The curve is a parabola that begins three quarters of the way down the vertical axis, and opens downward. It crosses the horizontal axis just to the right of the origin on its way upward and then again crosses the horizontal origin far to the right of the origin on its way downward. The maximum is above the horizontal axis, about halfway along the horizontal axis.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t, and the vertical axis is labeled p sub x. The curve on the vertical axis, is far above the origin, and extends very gradually downward and to the right briefly. It then moves downward and to the right, and crosses the horizontal axis about halfway along the axis. It continues downward and to the right until it reaches a point far below the horizontal axis. At this point, the curve moves very gradually downward and to the right until it ends.

The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled P sub x. The curve begins near the bottom of the vertical axis and extends out and to the right then bends up crossing over the horizontal axis at its halfway point. The curve continues up and to the right until reaching near the end of the vertical axis. The curve then bends to the right ending high above the end of the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure presents a graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled t and the vertical axis is labeled P sub x. The curve begins near the bottom of the vertical axis and extends out and to the right then bends up crossing over the horizontal axis at its halfway point. The curve continues up and to the right until reaching near the end of the vertical axis. The curve then bends to the right ending high above the end of the horizontal axis.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
